title: Quick Bee UI polish: integrate uploaded images + elegant styling refinements

requirements.summary: Add the 14 uploaded images as static frontend assets and reference them via a single shared mapping module.
acceptanceCriteria: All 14 uploaded images are present in the frontend static assets directory and load correctly in production build (no broken links in the UI).
No API/backend changes are required to display these images; they are loaded via static paths.
Images are referenced via a single, consistent mapping (e.g., a small constants module) rather than scattered hardcoded paths across many components.

requirements.summary: Use uploaded icon/illustration images across Dashboard, Planner, and Outreach for tabs, affordances, and empty states without breaking responsiveness.
acceptanceCriteria: At least one primary page (Dashboard) and at least two secondary pages (e.g., Planner and Outreach) visually incorporate the uploaded images in a way that is responsive and does not overflow on mobile.
Platform-related visuals in Outreach use the uploaded platform/icon images in tabs and/or empty states while keeping existing labels in English and maintaining usability/contrast.

Existing generated assets currently used (e.g., quickbee-app-icon, empty-state-dashboard) remain functional; if replaced, replacements must be from the uploaded images and must not degrade layout or readability.

file_operations.description: Import from the centralized uploaded image mapping and enhance the Dashboard empty state/hero visuals with an uploaded illustration (with responsive sizing and safe fallback so existing generated empty-state-dashboard remains functional).
Incorporate an uploaded illustration-style image into the Planner introduction card (responsive, non-overflowing), using the centralized uploaded image mapping.

Replace/augment platform tab visuals and empty-state cards with uploaded icon-style images (Email/Instagram/WhatsApp/DM/Phone/Deployment/Automation where appropriate), sourcing all paths from the centralized uploaded image mapping and ensuring mobile-safe layout.

Optionally elevate perceived quality by incorporating a subtle uploaded brand/illustration accent in the shell header area while preserving existing structure and keeping the generated quickbee-app-icon functional.

requirements.summary: Refine global elegance: typography hierarchy, spacing, card/panel styling, and consistent accessible hover/focus states across shell and key cards without editing shadcn/ui internals.
acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar header area, primary page headers, and key cards (stats/chart/export) show visibly improved spacing/typography consistency (clear hierarchy, consistent padding, balanced density).
Buttons/links have consistent hover/focus-visible states across pages, and focus styling is accessible (keyboard navigation clearly indicated).

Changes do not require editing any files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn components remain unmodified); composition and styling overrides are applied from app components/pages/CSS tokens instead.

file_operations.description: Refine global design tokens and add app-level utility classes (via Tailwind layers) for consistent page headers, card density, and accessible focus-visible styling while keeping the teal/black/white direction.
Align sidebar header spacing/typography and standardize nav link hover/focus-visible styles (keyboard-accessible) without modifying shadcn/ui components.
Tune layout spacing/padding and background separation for a more elegant shell presentation while maintaining the existing TanStack Router + AppShell structure.
Improve stats card hierarchy (title/value/subtitle), padding consistency, and subtle interactive states via composition/class overrides (do not edit shadcn/ui internals).
Standardize chart block header typography and spacing to match StatsCard and other panels, using only wrapper-level styling.
Polish Export Data section card density, button grid rhythm, and hover/focus-visible consistency for an elegant feel while keeping existing export logic unchanged.
